content: The document converted to {{title}} to allow its editing

comment.text: The translation key "Editor:DocumentConverted" is used to display a message indicating that a document has been converted to edit mode. This text appears in the UI after a document conversion process, typically displayed on-screen or in notifications.

ai_spell_check_issues.description: The Azerbaijani translation 'Sənəd redaktə etmək üçün {{title}}-a çevrildi' is a literal translation that doesn't quite convey the intended meaning. It implies the document *became* something else to be editable, rather than being converted *to* a format to allow editing.
ai_spell_check_issues.suggestion: Sənəd redaktə imkanı yaratmaq üçün {{title}} formatına çevrildi

ai_spell_check_issues.description: While technically correct, the phrasing 'Sənəd redaktə etmək üçün...' is a bit clunky in Azerbaijani. A more natural construction is possible.
The phrase "to allow its editing" is a bit awkward. A more natural translation would be "за да може да се редактира" or "за да се позволи редакторски достъп".
ai_spell_check_issues.suggestion: Документът се преобразува в {{title}}, за да може да се редактира.

ai_spell_check_issues.description: The English phrase 'to allow its editing' is not directly and naturally translated in the Czech version. 'Aby bylo možné jej upravovat' is grammatically correct but sounds somewhat formal. A more natural phrasing might be 'pro úpravu' or 'aby se dal upravovat'.

The English phrase 'The document converted to {{title}}' is awkward and doesn't accurately convey the intended meaning. A more natural translation would be something like 'The document was converted to {{title}}'.
ai_spell_check_issues.suggestion: Asiakirja on muutettu {{title}} muotoon, jotta sitä voidaan muokata

ai_spell_check_issues.description: The phrase 'to allow its editing' is not accurately reflected in the Armenian translation. While technically correct, it's a bit clunky. A more natural phrasing would improve readability.
ai_spell_check_issues.suggestion: Consider rephrasing 'խմբագրումը թույլ տալու համար' to something like 'խմբագրելու համար' (for editing) or 'խմբագրման համար' (for the purpose of editing).

ai_spell_check_issues.description: The phrase "to allow its editing" is not accurately conveyed.  "편집할 수 있도록" means 'so that it can be edited', but the original English implies the document was *converted* to enable editing. A more accurate translation would emphasize the conversion's purpose.
While technically correct, adding a slightly smoother transition between '{{title}}' and '로' would improve readability in Korean. The direct juxtaposition feels slightly abrupt.

The English phrase "The document converted to {{title}}" is not accurately translated. It implies a transformation or conversion, but the Lao translation focuses on the document *being* changed. A more accurate translation might emphasize the conversion process.
ai_spell_check_issues.suggestion: ເອກະສານຖືກປ່ຽນແບງເປັນ {{title}} ເພື່ອໃຫ້ສາມາດດັດປ່ຽນໄດ້

ai_spell_check_issues.description: The translation 'O documento convertido em {{title}} para permitir que seja editado' isn't the most natural or accurate rendering of 'The document converted to {{title}} to allow its editing'.  'Em' can imply transformation or inclusion, whereas 'to' implies a destination or purpose.
ai_spell_check_issues.suggestion: O documento convertido para {{title}} para permitir sua edição.

ai_spell_check_issues.description: While 'para permitir que seja editado' is grammatically correct, 'para permitir sua edição' is more concise and common in Portuguese.

The translation 'ලේඛනය එහි සංස්කරණයට ඉඩ දීම සඳහා {{title}} වෙත පරිවර්තනය කරන ලදී' doesn't quite capture the nuance of 'The document converted to {{title}} to allow its editing'.  The Sinhala implies the conversion *gave* permission for editing, rather than simply being the process that enabled it. A more accurate translation would emphasize the conversion *facilitated* editing.
ai_spell_check_issues.suggestion: ලේඛනය සංස්කරණය කිරීමේ හැකියාව ලබා දීමට {{title}} වෙත පරිවර්තනය කරන ලදී

ai_spell_check_issues.description: The placement of the placeholder '{{title}}' might not align with the English original's intended context. Double-check that it fits grammatically and logically within the Sinhala sentence.
ai_spell_check_issues.suggestion: Review the placement of '{{title}}' to ensure it flows naturally within the Sinhala sentence.

ai_spell_check_issues.description: The English phrase "to allow its editing" is not perfectly captured by "како би омогућио уређивање". A more direct translation might be "да би се могао уређивати" or "за уређивање".  The current translation implies something enabling the editing, whereas the English implies allowance for it.
ai_spell_check_issues.suggestion: Документ је конвертован у {{title}} да би се могао уређивати

ai_spell_check_issues.description: The English phrase 'to allow its editing' is not accurately conveyed by 'düzenlenmesine izin vermek için'. A more natural Turkish translation would be 'düzenlenebilmesi için' or 'düzenlenmesi amacıyla'. The current translation implies the conversion *allowed* editing, rather than being *for the purpose of* enabling it.
The phrase "to allow its editing" is not perfectly conveyed. A more natural Vietnamese phrasing would be 'để có thể chỉnh sửa' or 'để chỉnh sửa được'.
ai_spell_check_issues.suggestion: Tài liệu được chuyển đổi sang {{title}} để có thể chỉnh sửa
